           <h1>
            <span itemprop="name">
             Extreme Lemonade Layer Cake
            </span>
           </h1>
           <hr/>
           <div class="row">
            <div class="column w6040">
             <div class="column ">

           <div class="row p20t">
            <meta content="http://www.bitememore.com/feedme/336/extreme-lemonade-layer-cake" itemprop="url"/>
            <img alt="Extreme Lemonade Layer Cake" class="w100 wBorder" itemprop="image" src="http://www.bitememore.com/media/feed/336_1532485935_l.jpg" title="Extreme Lemonade Layer Cake"/>
           </div>
           <div class="row p20t">
            <span itemprop="description">
             Lisa and I have had our fair share of lemonade stand-offs. We set up shop 15 paces apart to see who's the superior street salesperson. Her stand always has a lineup down the block. Could be because I sell for a buck-a-cup while she gives it away. Or it might be that while I pour warm lemonade from a carton, hers is icy cold and hand-squeezed. Fine. Lisa understands lemonade and has proven it with this zingy cake, moist layers infused with all things lemon and topped with a lemon-cream-cheese frosting. Hope Lisa can keep up with the demand because I'm going to be charging at least $10 a slice for her masterful lemonade layer cake.
            </span>
           </div>
           <div class="row p20t">
            <div id="ingredients">
             <h3>
              Ingredients
             </h3>
             <br/>
             <span itemprop="ingredients">
              <span class="blurbTextBold">
               Lemonade Cake
              </span>
              <br/>
              <br/>
              2 cups flour
              <br/>
              1 tbsp lemon zest
              <br/>
              1 tsp baking powder
              <br/>
               tsp baking soda
              <br/>
               tsp kosher salt
              <br/>
               cup butter, softened
              <br/>
              2 cups sugar
              <br/>
              3 large eggs
              <br/>
              2 tsp vanilla extract
              <br/>
              3 tbsp thawed frozen-lemonade concentrate
              <br/>
              1 cup buttermilk
              <br/>
               cup fresh lemon juice
              <br/>
              <br/>
              <span class="blurbTextBold">
               Lemonade Frosting
              </span>
              <br/>
              <br/>
              1 (8oz) package cream cheese, softened
              <br/>
               cup butter, softened
              <br/>
              1 tbsp thawed frozen-lemonade concentrate
              <br/>
              2 tsp lemon zest
              <br/>
               tsp vanilla extract
              <br/>
              4 cups icing sugar
             </span>
            </div>
            <div id="bitemebit">
             <div id="biteme_bit">
              <span class="red">
               Bite
              </span>
              Me
              <span class="red">
               Bit
              </span>
             </div>
             <hr/>
             <div class="quote typewriter p30t p30b">
              "At my lemonade stand I used to give the first glass away free and charge give dollars for the second glass. The refill contained the antidote."
              <br/>
              <br/>
              - Emo Phillips, comedian
             </div>
             <hr/>
             <br/>
             <br/>
            </div>
            <div id="directions">
             <h3>
              Directions
             </h3>
             <br/>
             <span itemprop="recipeInstructions">
              <span class="redBold">
               1)
              </span>
              For the cake, preheat oven to 350F. Coat two 9-inch round cake pans with non-stick cooking spray. In a small bowl, combine flour, lemon zest, baking powder, baking soda and salt. Set aside.
              <br/>
              <br/>
              <span class="redBold">
               2)
              </span>
              Using an electric mixer, cream butter and sugar on medium speed, until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs one at a time. Mix in vanilla and lemonade concentrate.
              <br/>
              <br/>
              <span class="redBold">
               3)
              </span>
              In a small bowl, combine buttermilk and lemon juice. Alternate adding flour mixture and buttermilk mixture to mixer, beginning and ending with the flour. Mix just until combined. Divide batter evenly between prepared pans and bake 20-24 minutes until a toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean. Cool in pans for 10 minutes before removing to wire racks. Cool cakes completely before frosting.
              <br/>
              <br/>
              <span class="redBold">
               4)
              </span>
              For the frosting, in an electric mixer, beat cream cheese and butter until well combined. On low speed, add lemonade concentrate, lemon zest, vanilla and icing sugar. Scrape down the sides of the bowl and beat for 30 seconds on medium speed until smooth and creamy.
              <br/>
              <br/>
              <span class="redBold">
               5)
              </span>
              To assemble the cake, place 1 layer on a serving plate and spread with 1 cup frosting. Top with cake layer and spread remaining frosting over the top and sides of the cake.
              <br/>
              <br/>
              Serves 10-12
              <br/>
              <br/>
              <br/>
              <br/>
              <br/>
             </span>
            </div>
           </div>
           <div id="printzone" style="display:none">
            <br/>
            <br/>
            Extreme Lemonade Layer Cake
            <br/>
            <br/>
            Lisa and I have had our fair share of lemonade stand-offs. We set up shop 15 paces apart to see who's the superior street salesperson. Her stand always has a lineup down the block. Could be because I sell for a buck-a-cup while she gives it away. Or it might be that while I pour warm lemonade from a carton, hers is icy cold and hand-squeezed. Fine. Lisa understands lemonade and has proven it with this zingy cake, moist layers infused with all things lemon and topped with a lemon-cream-cheese frosting. Hope Lisa can keep up with the demand because I'm going to be charging at least $10 a slice for her masterful lemonade layer cake.
            <br/>
            Ingredients
            <br/>
            <br/>
            <span class="blurbTextBold">

            </span>

            <br/>
            2 cups flour
            <br/>
            1 tbsp lemon zest
            <br/>
            1 tsp baking powder
            <br/>
             tsp baking soda
            <br/>
             tsp kosher salt
            <br/>
             cup butter, softened
            <br/>
            2 cups sugar
            <br/>
            3 large eggs
            <br/>
            2 tsp vanilla extract
            <br/>
            3 tbsp thawed frozen-lemonade concentrate
            <br/>
            1 cup buttermilk
            <br/>
             cup fresh lemon juice
            <br/>
            <br/>
            <span class="blurbTextBold">
             Lemonade Frosting
            </span>
            <br/>
            <br/>
            1 (8oz) package cream cheese, softened
            <br/>
             cup butter, softened
            <br/>
            1 tbsp thawed frozen-lemonade concentrate
            <br/>
            2 tsp lemon zest
            <br/>
             tsp vanilla extract
            <br/>
            4 cups icing sugar
            <br/>
            Directions
            <br/>
            <br/>
            <span class="redBold">
             1)
            </span>
            For the cake, preheat oven to 350F. Coat two 9-inch round cake pans with non-stick cooking spray. In a small bowl, combine flour, lemon zest, baking powder, baking soda and salt. Set aside.
            <br/>
            <br/>
            <span class="redBold">
             2)
            </span>
            Using an electric mixer, cream butter and sugar on medium speed, until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs one at a time. Mix in vanilla and lemonade concentrate.
            <br/>
            <br/>
            <span class="redBold">
             3)
            </span>
            In a small bowl, combine buttermilk and lemon juice. Alternate adding flour mixture and buttermilk mixture to mixer, beginning and ending with the flour. Mix just until combined. Divide batter evenly between prepared pans and bake 20-24 minutes until a toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean. Cool in pans for 10 minutes before removing to wire racks. Cool cakes completely before frosting.
            <br/>
            <br/>
            <span class="redBold">
             4)
            </span>
            For the frosting, in an electric mixer, beat cream cheese and butter until well combined. On low speed, add lemonade concentrate, lemon zest, vanilla and icing sugar. Scrape down the sides of the bowl and beat for 30 seconds on medium speed until smooth and creamy.
            <br/>
            <br/>
            <span class="redBold">
             5)
            </span>
            To assemble the cake, place 1 layer on a serving plate and spread with 1 cup frosting. Top with cake layer and spread remaining frosting over the top and sides of the cake.
            <br/>
            <br/>
            Serves 10-12
            <br/>
            <br/>
            <br/>
            <br/>
            <br/>
            <br/>
